name: Ellis Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our 12-year anniversary celebration. The hotel was very nice, up to date, clean, and comfy. The room was not huge but was just right for us. The staff was friendly, which made the trip and stay even better. We traveled the city by way of the Marta, which is right next to the Hotel. This was very convenient because the Marta makes stops throughout the city, which allowed us to sight see in different areas without having to drive. I would highly recommend this hotel for a nice weekend for couples or even a solo trip.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here back in April. I liked it so much that I immediately booked a room for this trip to the apparel show.
reviews.title: Classy comfort. Friendliest staff ever!

reviews.text: The staff, once again, was cheerful, helpful and friendly. As a matter of fact, I stay in many hotels because I travel a lot for business and I can't think of any other hotel where the staff is as nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely. The beds are super comfortable with lots of pillows. You definitely get good value for your money here. I like their restaurant that serves organic food.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, parking situation was disappointing

reviews.text: I know some other people have mentioned the expense of the valet parking. But I'm used to parking in large cities where even self parking in a garage can run 40.00 for an overnight. So I thought the 22.00 daily price they charged for having someone park my car for me and bring it up front whenever I needed it was quite reasonable.
reviews.title: Moved entire block to a different hotel without notice

reviews.text: I'm not having the same customer service experiece as the other travelers. Here's mine: I checked in at midnight, worked until 2a on a very slow internet connection; it was almost unuseably slow. The phone in my room wasn't working, so I called the desk from my cell phone. After more than 20 rings, they picked up and arranged a manual wakeup at 7a. (They also said they'd send engineering to look at my phone the next day). At 6:30a the girl at the front desk decided to TEST THE PHONE! She said she was aware of my wakeup time, and from talking to her she was clearly not engineering. So your guess is as good as mine.
reviews.title: No Words for It....

reviews.text: I'm a very regular business traveler for the past 20 years worldwide. From the other reviews this seems to be an isolated incident but the combination of poorly-working communications systems and front desk amateurity caused problems for me as a business traveler.
reviews.title: It beats the Ritz Carlton - right across the street!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my sixth time to stay at The Ellis for business. I used to stay at the Ritz, across the street. The Ellis is a GREAT boutique hotel, super staff, and rooms on par with any "W". Easy acces to your room with the small intimate lobby, and the rooms, although not huge, are a perfect size and very well-appointed! The staff will go out of their way to assist you!
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel and value

reviews.text: We were convinced by earlier reviews to stay at the Ellis for 3 nights. The reviews were right, what an outstanding hotel. It is beautifully decorated, comfortable. adn very centrally located to MARTA, restaurants, and attractions. The hotel staff was extraordinarily helpful and professional and courteous. They gave us a lot of personal help and attention. An amazing value and wonderful venue for a long weekend. We very highly recommend the Ellis Hotel.
reviews.title: It exeeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time that we arrived to the time we left we were really impressed with the staff. The valet who was the first to greet us was very nice and greeted us warmly. A quick visit to the front desk, where our reservation was in order, and the personell was very courteous. The bell hop came out to unload all of our bags, take them up to our room, and took time to explain all of the features the hotel had to offer. I was very impressed with the proffesionlism shown by the whole staff.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: This hotel is a good choice for downtown. It has some nice touches the larger chain hotels do not have. It is a much more intimate setting and you will feel wecome by the Ellis staff.
reviews.title: Nice Independent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness room is tiny, but apparently if you ask at the desk they give you free access to a large gym down the block. The bed was extremely comfortable, however make sure you get a room on a higher floor. I was on the 3rd floor (the lowest) and the street noise was very loud in the morning (idling buses, garbage trucks, etc.).
reviews.title: One of the best....

reviews.text: Generally, I’m not one to write reviews on hotels, but the Ellis defiantly deserves one. We spent one night at the boutique style hotel last weekend and we’re completely impressed by the attention to detail. The hotel boosts a trendy decor with a 1st class staff. Would recommend to both business and leisure travelers.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ellis for four nights while attending a business conference. The woman who checked us in was friendly and informative. When we called down a few minutes later to ask for a room on a higher floor she accommodated us with the same demeanor. The decor is beautiful, the beds very comfortable and the bathroom roomy. Everyone on the staff that we encountered could not have been more attentive. Special kudos to Jonathan, the doorman. He was especially helpful. We had breakfast in the dining room each morning. Words can't describe the quality of the food. Everything is locally grown and extremely fresh. The staff took the time to remember our likes and dislikes from the day before. Just a nice, friendly touch not found in many hotels. I should mention that we used to travel extensively for business so have a great deal of experience with hotels and I have to say that this was probably the best experience we've ever had in a hotel. That includes the "luxury" hotels. The location is great. Near everything. All in all a great experience.
reviews.title: An outstanding place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Ellis in Atlanta, GA. The accommodations were outstanding and the staff went about the call of duty to make our stay more than we could have hoped for. When my husband ask one of the bellstaff for directions to a nearby business they not only told him where it was but they also walked him there. Wow! That is service!
reviews.title: It was the perfect place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent. I've never stayed at a hotel where they try so hard. They also take a keen interest in trip adviser and are really pleased that they rank so well! In the evenings they have candles (not real but look really good) decorating the stair case. A wine tasting in the lounge at 5.30. The rooms are lovely, clean, comfortable beds, flat screen TVs, coffee making facilities. Everything you could want. The best thing is the staff. Roland on the front desk made us feel so welcome. We had a really good laugh! And my Sound of Music duet with lady who checked us out was a triumph. Would definitely recommend to anyone. Was sorry to leave! Atlanta does not feel like the safest city in the US. But the security in this hotel was very good and we felt very safe here.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm, security and southern hospitality

reviews.text: Well located. Great staff. Very clean. No frills. Newspaper daily.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Will return.

reviews.text: Super comfortable bed. We hear the noise from the car but it is not major.
reviews.title: Gret experience- recommended

reviews.text: We will definetly choose this hotel on our next visit.
reviews.title: Going to the GA Dome/CNN/World of Coke? This place is for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a great experience at the Ellis hotel in Atlanta. The location is ideal - a short walk to the Georgia Aquarium and World of Coca Cola. The entire staff was friendly and helpful from the front desk staff to the valets. The room was nice. My only complaint was that the AC was rather loud.
reviews.title: Ellis Top Notch

description: Luxury, boutique, hip downtown Atlanta hotel with 4 star service at affordable prices. Everything from our contemporary decor to our quietly attentive staff has been thoughtfully designed for the definitive indulgent experience. Following an impressive $28 million restoration, our hotel rooms blend sleek design and down home southern comforts with unmatched access to the heart of downtown … within walking distance of restaurants, corporations, and attractions.
